ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is an introductory course that covers a substantial area of C++ programming. I certainly would recommend this course to another student because what this course covers is fundamental in computer science.

Good course that would be better if there was a C++ precursor course. This would allow for more focus on more examples of object-oriented approaches.Would definitely recommend this course. I took it as a quick way to learn more about C++, and at the very least, it certainly has done that.
Yes. It's a great course for new computer science students. Basic programming concepts, and appropriate amount of practice.
Yes, I will recommend it to other students, It's a very useful course. People can learn a lot.
I would recommend it. It is useful.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course refreshed my knowledge on C++ programming, which is an essential tool for my research on computer graphics.
Enables me to approach my code for my research in a better way.
It is necessary to practice code style. This course is a good choice.
It is a useful base course. Learning programming language in this course helps to complete work in other courses.
